zh: 他的故事比她的故事有趣得多。

en: His story made us laugh.
zh: 他的故事让我们笑了。

en: His story seems to be strange.
zh: 他的故事似乎很奇怪。

en: You should discount his story.
zh: 你应该对他的故事打个折扣。

en: You'd better take his words with a grain of salt.
zh: 你最好对他的话持保留态度。

en: His story was interesting to us all.
zh: 他的故事让我们所有人都觉得很有趣。

en: His story may sound false, but it is true for all that.
zh: 他的故事听起来可能很假，但无论如何都是真的。

en: His story amused everyone.
zh: 他的故事逗乐了所有人。

en: His story will be more and more interesting.
zh: 他的故事会越来越有趣。

en: His description approximated to the truth.
zh: 他的描述接近事实。

en: I can hardly believe his story.
zh: 我简直不敢相信他的故事。

en: His talk was so much to the purpose that all the class understood it.
zh: 他的话非常切题，全班都听懂了。

en: His story was highly amusing to us.
zh: 他的故事非常有趣，我们都很喜欢。

en: His story was made up.
zh: 他的故事是编造的。

en: His speech was suitable for the occasion.
zh: 他的演讲很适合这个场合。

en: His speech was not very becoming to the occasion.
zh: 他的演讲不太适合这个场合。

en: His story wasn't appropriate for the occasion.
zh: 他的故事不适合这个场合。

en: His story sounds strange.
zh: 他的故事听起来很奇怪。

en: His story excited everyone's curiosity.
zh: 他的故事激起了每个人的好奇心。

en: There has a ring of falsehood in his story.
zh: 他的故事听起来有点假。

en: His story can't be false.
zh: 他的故事不可能是假的。

en: He frequently jumps from one topic to another while he is talking.
zh: 他说话时经常从一个话题跳到另一个话题。

en: His talk is always pleasant to listen to.
zh: 他的谈话总是令人愉快。

en: His story was so funny that everyone could not help laughing.
zh: 他的故事太有趣了，大家都忍不住笑了。

en: His story is strange, but it's believable.
zh: 他的故事很奇怪，但却是可信的。

en: The emphasis of his talk was on the need to work hard.
zh: 他的谈话重点是强调努力工作的必要性。

en: She couldn't get the point of his story.
zh: 她不明白他的故事的重点。

en: The content of his speech is not relevant to the subject.
zh: 他的演讲内容与主题无关。

en: I wrote down every phrase in his speech that he stressed.
zh: 我记下了他演讲中强调的每一个短语。
